similarOrganizations.name: Nestlé
similarOrganizations.description:
As the world’s largest food and beverage company we are driven by a simple aim: unlocking the power of food to enhance quality of life for everyone, today and for generations to come. To deliver on this, we serve with passion, with a spirit of excellence, offering products and services for all stages of life, every moment of the day, helping people care for themselves and their families. Our culture is based on our values rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for the future.

We can trace our origin back to 1866, when the first European condensed milk factory was opened in Cham, Switzerland, by the Anglo-Swiss Condensed Milk Company. One year later, Henri Nestlé, a trained pharmacist, launched one of the world’s first prepared infant cereals ‘Farine lactée’ in Vevey, Switzerland.

Today, we employ around 273,000 people and have factories or operations in almost every country in the world. With our headquarters still based in the Swiss town of Vevey, we had sales of CHF 84.3 billion in 2020.

Our portfolio covers almost every food and beverage category – offering products and services for all stages of life, every moment of the day, helping people care for themselves and their families.

Goethe University Frankfurt is a research-oriented university in the European financial center Frankfurt am Main. The university was founded in 1914 through private funding, primarily from Jewish sponsors, and has since produced pioneering achievements in the areas of social sciences, sociology and economics, medicine, quantum physics, brain research, and labor law. 

With more than 43,000 students, Goethe University is one of the largest universities in Germany. 154 degree programs are available for students to choose from. A total of 580 professors and 2,261 research assistants teach and conduct research at Goethe University. Together with the Technical University of Darmstadt and the Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz, Goethe University Frankfurt is a partner in the Strategic Alliance of Rhine-Main-Universities.

BVS Founder and CEO, Pamela Gardner is a trailblazer in promoting thought leadership and empowerment in the science industry. This self-described “Bad-Ass Butterfly,” is fearlessly on a mission to help others tackle the tough equity issues of female empowerment and systemic racism to break through the barriers that exist within the system.
  
She has created a business model which allows her to further integrate her “why” to empower women and men in science into her existing business. Through her extensive network and loyal followers, she has been able to catapult thought leadership on a nationwide scale to people within the science industry.

With this approach we can generate treatments for neuroscience and brain health diseases that have been historically difficult to treat efficaciously.

Our philosophy is to offer no lectures or agenda, or JUNK emails but instead offer a pure networking experience to all.

similarOrganizations.name: INRAD - Instituto de Radiologia do Hospital das Clínicas FMUSP
similarOrganizations.description:
O Instituto de Radiologia do Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da Universidade de São Paulo –  INRAD, vem desde a sua criação através  do decreto nº 39.469, datado de 04 de novembro de 1994, cumprindo perante o Sistema FMUSPHC e a sociedade a sua missão de promover o conhecimento científico, por meio as atividades de ensino, pesquisa, formação e capacitação de recursos humanos, prestação de serviços de atenção à saúde e tratamento na área de diagnóstico por imagem e oncologia terapêutica.

O INRAD tem como foco a qualidade do atendimento, e isso, demanda um contínuo investimento em infra-estrutura, aquisição de tecnologia de ponta, expansão dos seus serviços e, principalmente, a manutenção do seu capital intelectual, alinhado a um corpo de profissionais altamente qualificado. Uma característica importante é o investimento em parcerias público-privadas, que permitem viabilizar projetos de vanguarda, como o Cíclotron, que será a primeira Unidade de Produção de Radiofármacos instalada em hospital público.

O Instituto de Radiologia (INRAD) foi criado em 1994 para equipar o HC com os mais modernos recursos diagnósticos e terapêuticos por imagem. Esse centro de excelência é composto de dois prédios. O principal abriga recursos ambulatoriais de radiologia convencional e intervencionista e de radioterapia. No prédio anexo fica o Centro de Medicina Nuclear (CMN), pioneiro no desenvolvimento de radiofármacos, produzidos por Cíclotron, para tratamento e pesquisa em oncologia e neurologia.

O INRAD tem, ainda, o Centro de Diagnóstico por Imagem das Doenças da Mama (CEDIM) e o Núcleo Técnico-Científico de Diagnóstico por Imagem (NDI). Esse último implementou o sistema de armazenamento e distribuição digital de imagens, que dá acesso às informações para qualquer unidade do hospital e dispensou a impressão dos laudos e imagens dos exames.

similarOrganizations.name: InRAD – International, practice-based registry for Alzheimer's Disease and other dementias
similarOrganizations.description:
Our vision is a world where every person affected by Alzheimer's disease and related dementias can receive personalised care and timely access to available treatments. We are dedicated to accelerating progress and enhancing the quality of life for those impacted by these conditions. 
 
InRAD, currently in development, is an international practice-based patient registry. It offers collaborative database tools and research capabilities at no cost, aiming to deepen understanding of dementias through epidemiological and therapeutic outcomes studies, including effectiveness and safety. 
 
Guided by founding Board members Professor Robert Perneczky and Professor Frank Jessen, who will be joined by additional international Board members soon, InRAD is driven by a co-founding team; Rob Hyde, Johan van Beek, and Tracy Willmott who bring expertise in real-world evidence, medical operations and medical communications respectively.  
 
From late 2024, a Cloud-based data entry platform, equipped with established governance and ethics frameworks, will be implemented across partner centres to facilitate the management of Alzheimer's patients. By 2025/2026, the collaborative registry platform will be available, featuring secure, regionally compliant Azure Cloud-based data storage and sharing capabilities to facilitate studies and evidence generation. 
 
InRAD is building a network of future investigator sites, partners, and collaborators. We are committed to constructing a sustainable platform that offers benefits to participating centres and patients. 
 
For updates on our progress, please visit www.InRADnetwork.org. 
 
We extend our thanks to Eli Lilly for funding some of our initial projects.
 
We are seeking sponsorship from like-minded collaborators who believe in the power of using real world data to make a difference to the lives of people with Alzheimer’s and other dementias. Visit www.InRADnetwork.org for details.

similarOrganizations.name: NanoFUSE Biologics
similarOrganizations.description: NanoFuse Biologics LLC, wholly owned by NANISX LLC (a KIC Ventures portfolio company), features NanoFuse® DBM, the first FDA-approved combination of synthetic bioactive ceramic 45S5 bioglass and demineralized bone matrix (DBM) for bone regeneration, promoting fusion and healing. When combined with aqueous body fluid, NanoFuse forms a 3D ultra-porous calcium hydroxyapatite layer within 24 hours, creating a strong bond with adjacent bone. This process triggers osteoblast differentiation, accelerates osteogenesis, and enhances bone growth. Additionally, in vitro studies show ionic release (Ca) and pH changes inherent to bioactive glass create an unfavorable environment for microbes, adding an antimicrobial benefit. Guided by LESS™ Exposure Spine Surgery (LESS) principles and the Restore Function, Early Intervention, and Preserve Anatomy (REP) methodology, NanoFuse Biologics is a trusted bone void filler for fusion and regeneration. With a proven clinical record and patented manufacturing, NanoFuse Biologics LLC delivers a reliable bone regeneration solution.

similarOrganizations.name: Soteria Medical BV
similarOrganizations.description:
Soteria Medical B.V. is a Spin Off from Radboudumc in Nijmegen, The Netherlands.
​Many years of development and clinical research have resulted in a new approach to perform MRI guided interventions by utilizing a robotic device, which is fully MR-compatible and allows real time positioning in the MR scanner.

The scope of the company is the development, production and sales of medical devices and instruments - specifically in the field of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and MRI guided interventions. Soteria’s initial product is a robotic manipulator for MRI guided prostate biopsies and interventions - utilizing a newly developed and patented motor principle. 

​The innovations of the company will benefit patients worldwide, especially patients with early stage prostate cancer, who have not received sufficient diagnosis with the current standard of care.

Curaway Medical is located in Hangzhou, China. Meanwhile, the company establish long-term cooperative relationships with prestigious universities, institutes, R&D centers and clinical experts team. Focusing on global advanced technology and combining clinical practice experience, to provide customers with device for minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment.
Curaway multiple product lines include biopsy needle products for diagnosis, Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) for treatment and surgical navigation puncture robot. In addition, Curaway develop a large number of practical and affordable surgical products such as disposable needle guider, breast localization wire, wound closure device and wearable medical bandage. The company passed ISO 9000, ISO 9001 international quality certification and owned a large number of independent intellectual property rights.

similarOrganizations.name: Magnamed
similarOrganizations.description:
A Magnamed é uma empresa brasileira voltada para o mercado de critical care  especializada em ventilação pulmonar. A companhia destaca-se no desenvolvimento de equipamentos médicos hospitalares de alta tecnologia e inovação inteligente para vida.

Entre 2012 e 2014, a empresa registrou um crescimento de 150%. No início de 2015, entrou em operação a nova fábrica da Magnamed, localizada no distrito industrial de Cotia, na grande São Paulo.

A Magnamed é uma das investidas do Fundo Criatec, cogerido pela INSEED e que realizou o primeiro round em 2008. 


The MAGNAMED is a Brazilian company focused on the critical care market specializing in pulmonary ventilation . The company stands out in the development of hospital medical equipment of high technology and intelligent innovation for life.

The company was founded in 2005 by three engineers partners, containing innovation in its DNA . The MAGNAMED is recognized in over 40 countries , in -depth knowledge and the constant search for new solutions to the market .

With six medical equipments in its portfolio – the lug ventilators Oxymag, OxyMag Agile, Fleximag, FlexiMag Plus,  Babymag and the testing equipment Ventmeter. Between 2012 and 2014, the company recorded a growth of 150%. In early 2015, came into operation a new Magnamed’s factory in Cotia’s Industrial District, localized in São Paulo.

Magnamed is one of the thrusts of Fundo Criatec, an Investment Fund which is co-managed by INSEED and whom held the first round in 2008.

similarOrganizations.name: Siemens Healthineers
similarOrganizations.description:
Siemens Healthineers is a leading medtech company with over 125 years of experience. We pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Our portfolio, spanning in vitro and in vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways. 

With our strengths in patient twinning, precision therapy, as well as digital, data, and artificial intelligence (AI), we are well positioned to take on the greatest challenges in healthcare. We will continue to build on these strengths to help overcome the world’s most threatening diseases, enable efficient operations, and expand access to care. 

We are a team of more than 71,000 Healthineers in over 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what is possible in healthcare to help improve the lives of people around the world.
